H0.text: A balance is the tool scientists use to study cells during their investigations.

H1.text: A microscope is the tool that scientists use to study cells during their investigations.

H2.text: A centimeter ruler is the tool that scientists use during their investigations to study cells.

H3.text: A graduated cylinder is a tool scientists use to study cells during their investigations.

A4.text: A microscope (from Ancient Greek  μικρός (mikrós) 'small' and  σκοπέω (skopéō) 'to look (at); examine, inspect') is a laboratory instrument used to examine objects that are too small to be seen by the naked eye.

A5.text: Van Leeuwenhoek re-discovered red blood cells (after Jan Swammerdam) and spermatozoa, and helped popularise the use of microscopes to view biological ultrastructure.
